email_confirmation_subject: Welcome on Inventaire.io! Here is the link to confirm your email address
email_confirmation_paragraph: Please, visit this link so that we can use your email address in the future, knowing it's really yours (to help you reset your password for instance).
friendship_request_subject: %{username} invites you to connect your inventories!
friendship_request_button: go to %{username}'s inventory to accept the invitation
you_are_welcome_to_reply: **you are very welcome to reply to this email** for any question or feedback
get_involved: Do you think you can contribute and make Inventaire better? Get involved!
contribution_ideas: Ask to be added to the [project development board](https://trello.com/b/0lKcsZDj/inventaire-community), join the [translation team](https://www.transifex.com/organization/inventaire/), post an [issue on github](https://github.com/inventaire/inventaire/issues), or simply start a discussion by answering this email!
stop_email_notifications: [change emails settings](https://inventaire.io/settings/notifications). For any problem or question, send an email at: [help@inventaire.io](mailto:help@inventaire.io?subject=Help!&body=Dear%20Inventaire%2C%5Cn%20I%20need%20your%20help%3A)
reset_password_paragraph:
We received a request to reset the password for your account **%{username}**.
If you made this request, click the button below. If you didn't make this request, you can ignore this email.

email_invitation_subject: %{username} invited you to share your books on Inventaire.io!
email_invitation_intro: Inventaire is a web application that lets you share the inventory of your books with your friends and communities
email_invitation_button: Sign up and start sharing books with %{username}
email_invitation_user_inventory: You can already see %{username}'s public books [here](%{pathname}) but you need an account to have access to all the books they want to share with you.
email_invitation_learn_more: Inventaire is a project fighting for better information on resources, while implementing [knowledge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_knowledge) and [code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_software) freedom, and giving users control of their data: [learn more on inventaire.io](https://inventaire.io/welcome)
stop_email_invitations: If you don't want to receive emails from us, send an email at [stop-emails@inventaire.io](mailto:stop-emails@inventaire.io?subject=Please%20never%20email%20me%20again&body=I'm%20sorry%20this%20would%20never%20have%20worked%20between%20us.%20Love)

If there is anything you would like to see appear in those activity summaries, you can send your suggestions by replying to this email
last_friends_books: new books in your friends inventories
did_you_know_1: If your friends aren't on inventaire.io yet, you can [invite them by email](https://inventaire.io/network/users/invite) to start sharing your books inventories!
did_you_know_2:
There are two different text fields on each of your books' page:
- in **details**, anything you write will be visible by anyone who can see the book.
- in **private notes**, everything you write will be visible just by you, whatever the book's visibility settings are
did_you_know_3: You can contribute to the future of inventaire.io by [voting for the next features](https://trello.com/b/0lKcsZDj/inventaire-roadmap)!
did_you_know_4: Using a pseudonyme is perfectly fine on inventaire.io, but if you want people to find you or if you want to invite other users to connect as friends, [make sure you have a profile picture or a bio](https://inventaire.io/me) that they can recognize
news_3:
Hello!
Last time we introduced the possibility to see [geolocated users](https://inventaire.io/network/users/nearby), now you can also find [groups nearby](https://inventaire.io/network/groups/nearby)! If you already created a group and want it to appear on the map, go to your [group's settings](https://inventaire.io/network/groups/user). If you haven't, you can always [create a group here](https://inventaire.io/network/groups/create). Groups are designed to regroup people who come to a place regularly - an office, a coworking, a university, etc. - but if you use it in other ways and miss a feature, let us know!

Maxime
